alert.note: Alert for Palo Alto; Pocahontas (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 13 at 11:42PM CDT until May 14 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT SUNDAY FOR SOUTHERN PALO ALTO AND NORTHERN POCAHONTAS COUNTIES... At 1142 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms had produced heavy rain across the warned area with as much as 3 to 7 inches from personal weather stations. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Laurens, Rush Lake, Rolfe, Mallard, Havelock, Plover and Curlew. Water was over N28 and Highway 10 earlier in the evening, but was expected to subside by this time. Ponding water should also continue to decrease overnight. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
